ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Pet commands
ygData.msgSnippet: Seeing as how a bard s charm only lasts 6 - 9 seconds and we don t need to med, /pet guard me does not see a lot of play. Draelon ... From: Webber, Jessica
ygData.messageBody:
Seeing as how a bard's charm only lasts 6 - 9 seconds and we don't need to
med, /pet guard me does not see a lot of play.

Draelon

-----Original Message-----
From: Webber, Jessica [mailto:webber@...]
Sent: Wednesday, March 29, 2000 10:49 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Pet commands


From: "Webber, Jessica" <webber@...>

Hadn't thought of the who leader one, thanks. Neither of you use /pet guard
me for when your medding? (like I said, this is for an alt, not my bard)

Peace
Evulia & her alts

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Benoit St-Hilaire [mailto:bsthilai@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, March 29, 2000 10:47 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Pet commands
>
>
> From: Benoit St-Hilaire <bsthilai@...>
>
> Another usefull pet command is
>
> /pet who leader
>
> Usefull in multigroup situation, to make sure the other group
> know that you have one charmed.
>
> Lonnie Lewis wrote:
>
> > From: Lonnie Lewis <llewis@...>
> >
> > The ones I use most during fighting is
> > /pet back off
> > /pet attack
> > /pet follow (if I'm having to pull) Did this alot in
> Cazic, because of the
> > horrible pathing, it was about the only way to get the
> lizzies to follow me
> > up the temple.
> >
> > And then just to amuse myself
> > /pet sit down (or is it just sit?)
> >
> > Bien
> >
> > > From: "Webber, Jessica" <webber@...>
> > >
> > > This isn't strictly a bard question, but it's not
> irrelevant either, so...
> > >
> > > What pet commands do you folks find yourselves using most
> often? I'm
> > > trying
> > > to arrange hot keys for one of my alts & I'm trying to
> use as few of them
> > > as
> > > possible.
> > >
> > > Thanks
> > > Evulia
